text:
Did you go out yesterday?  

Raskolnikov, pale and tense, stares fiercely.  

Ilya: “Though you were ill?”  
Raskolnikov: “Yes.”  
Ilya: “At what time?”  

---  

Raskolnikov shifts nervously, sweat beading.  

Ilya: “And where did you go?”  
Raskolnikov: “Along the street.”  

---  

Ilya: “Very well, then.”  
Raskolnikov exits, heart racing.  

Raskolnikov (thinking): “A search—there will be a search.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling faint and anxious, leaves a tense interrogation where he senses suspicion and anticipates a search at his home.
